description: An ancient site in the Argolid in Greece, it shares a name with the neighboring modern town.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: near Dendra

properties.title: OSM location of Cyclopean wall tract

history.comment: cleaned up wikipedia entry; added ToposText and MycAtlas references; added Wikidata and MANTO references provided by bkiesling; added CFL/AGO reference provided by cbouras; add Arachne Midea Argolis (Regionalbezirk) (Μίδεια), Griechenland - check in working copy @thomase
Location updates and tags from Johan Ahlfeldt's (jahlfeldt) Digital Atlas of the Roman Empire in October 2012
added Walberg 2007 to the place resource
Global migration and reindexing of citations and provenance, February 2012
New locations, coordinates, and metadata from Harvard's DARMC project. See http://atlantides.org/trac/pleiades/wiki/PlaceUpgradesAndMigrations
Detail text updated from former modernLocation. See http://atlantides.org/trac/pleiades/wiki/PlaceDetailsUpgrade
Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance
Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance

locations.title: OSM location of Cyclopean wall tract

history.comment: added Google Earth and GeoEye Imagery 2012
added dates based on Swedish Institute at Athens online precis, which I've cited; replaced ISBN on Walberg reference with Open Library URI.
current placement is way off.  Long-assumed placement, based upon long-term excavations by Swedish Institute, is by the modern town of Midea

references.formattedCitation: G. Walberg, Midea:  The Megaron Complex and Shrine Area.  Excavations on the Lower Terraces 1994 - 1997. (Prehistory Monographs 20) Institute for Aegean Prehistory, Philadelphia.
Swedish Institute at Athens, Dendra and Midea in the Argolid

history.comment: Global migration and reindexing of citations and provenance, February 2012

references.formattedCitation: Talbert, Richard J. A., ed. Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World. Princeton, N.J.: Princeton University Press, 2000. http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/43970336.
Lauffer, Siegfried. Griechenland: Lexikon der historischen Stätten von den Anfängen bis zur Gegenwart. München: Beck, 1989. http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/20780482.
Wikipedia: The Free Encyclopedia That Anyone Can Edit. Wikimedia Foundation, 2001. https://en.wikipedia.org.
Walberg, Gisela. Midea: The Megaron Complex And Shrine Area: Excavations on the Lower Terraces 1994-1997 (Prehistory Monographs) (Prehistory Monographs). INSTAP Academic Press, 2007.
Marc Wick, and Christophe Boutreux. “GeoNames,” 2005. http://www.geonames.org/.

Depauw, Mark, Tom Gheldof, Herbert Verreth, Nico Dogaer, Willy Clarysse, Yanne Broux, Gert Baetens, and Heinz-Josef Thissen. Trismegistos: An Interdisciplinary Portal of the Ancient World. Leuven, 2006. http://www.trismegistos.org/.

Michael McCormick, Giovanni Zambotti, Leland Grigoli, and Kelly Gibson, eds. The Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations. Cambridge (Massachusetts): Harvard University, 2007. https://darmc.harvard.edu/.
Kiesling, Brady. ToposText – a Reference Tool for Greek Civilization. Version 2.0. Aikaterini Laskaridis Foundation, 2016. https://topostext.org/.
Wikidata: The Free Knowledge Base That Anyone Can Edit. Wikimedia Foundation, 2014. https://www.wikidata.org/.
Hawes, Greta, and Scott Smith. MANTO. Accessed February 17, 2023. https://www.manto-myth.org/manto.

Veronique Chankowski, Amélie Perrier, Catherine Bouras, Sabine Fourrier, John Bennet, Michaeol Loy, Kostis Christakis, L. Mulot, and G. Bejjaji. Chronique Des Fouilles En Ligne = Archaeology in Greece Online. Athens: Ecole française d’Athènes and British School at Athens, 2018. https://chronique.efa.gr/?kroute=homepage.
Consoli, Robert H. Mycenaean Atlas Project, 2017. https://www.helladic.info.
Reinhard Foertsch, ed. Arachne: IDAI Objects. Köln; Berlin: Archaeological Institute, University of Cologne; German Archaeological Institute. Accessed February 5, 2020. https://arachne.uni-koeln.de/.
